question.q: Everything is made up of tiny particles called _____.
_____ are materials that allow electricity to flow through them easily.
Give three examples of good conductors: _____, _____, _____
_____ are materials that do *not* allow electricity to flow through them easily.
Give three examples of good insulators: _____, _____, _____
A _____ is a complete path that allows electricity to flow.
Draw a simple circuit diagram including a battery, a bulb, and a switch.
The flow of electric charge is called _____.
Electric current is measured in _____.
_____ is the electrical force that makes electric charges move.
Voltage is measured in _____.
A _____ is a device that can open or close a circuit.
When the switch is closed, the circuit is _____, and the bulb will _____.
When the switch is open, the circuit is _____, and the bulb will _____.
Explain why it is dangerous to touch electrical appliances with wet hands.
What is the purpose of a fuse?
Why should you never overload an electrical socket?
Explain what a short circuit is and why it is dangerous.
What should you do if you see a damaged electrical wire?
Why is it important to turn off electrical appliances when not in use?
Describe the function of a circuit breaker.
What is the difference between a battery and a cell?
Give two examples of safety devices used in electrical circuits: _____, _____
